page.title: 17Housing in Kinross.
page.content: Since the 1970's{housing}in Kinross has grown, particularly at the north end of the town. At present 4 private estates are being constructed. The size and style of these houses are largely aimed at the 40%+ of residents who work elsewhere or who will move here.{These people are mobile}in house and job, but give considerable support to local activities.{Development}of the older areas near the town centre have tried to keep its character, notably the renovation of Parliament Square.{Council housing}(35% of total) has not been increased recently but land is allocated for it. Just over 10% of council-built houses have been bought by their tenants.
